question.text: What are the adaptations seen in animals that live in water scarcity conditions?

options.text: Having a thick coat to minimise evaporative desiccation
Oxidising stored fat to produce water as by product
Producing very concentrated urine and solid faeces

solution.text: Kangaroo and desert rat seldom drink water. It has a thick coat to minimise evaporative desiccation. The animal seldom comes out of its comparatively humid and cool burrow during the day time <math><mn>90</mn><mi>%</mi></math> of its water requirement is met from metabolic water which is produced by respiratory breakdown of fats. <math><mn>10</mn><mi>%</mi></math> is obtained from food. Loss of water is minimised by producing nearly solid urine and faces.
